Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sclerotherapy for Chronic Venous Insufficiency

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trials and clinical trials

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with lower limb CVI grades C1-C6.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was sclerotherapy, compared to placebo, deferred ablation, and ligation therapy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was quality of life (QoL), measured using the VEINES-QOL scale over 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 9,670 participants were included, with 5,450 in the intervention group and 4,220 in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sclerotherapy significantly improved QoL (pooled MD = 10.34, 95% CI 8.78 to 11.90, p < 0.00001) and closure rates (pooled RR = 0.72, 95% CI 0.55 to 0.94, p = 0.001).
